newsitem.title: JAPAN: VW sees 1997 Japan sales of 70,000 cars.
newsitem.headline: VW sees 1997 Japan sales of 70,000 cars.

text.p: Volkswagen hopes to boost its Japanese sales of Volkswagen and Audi cars to about 70,000 in 1997, a spokeswoman for Volkswagen Japan said on Thursday.
Its sales in Japan this year are expected to reach 60,000 cars, up sharply from 45,774 in 1995.

The spokesman said Volkswagen would cut the sticker prices in Japan of its Golf GIT16V, Golf VR6, Golf Cabriolet and VW Vento VR6 models, at the higher end of its Golf and Vento series, by 5.5 to 9.7 percent, effective on January 1.
The price reduction partly reflects a drop in distribution costs due to strong sales of the Golf Wagon and Polo models recently introduced in Japan.
